page.title: 12R.A.F. INNSWORTH (2)
page.content: AT INNSWORTH THE VARIOUS RANKS (AIRMEN, SERGEANTS AND OFFICERS) EACH HAVE THEIR OWN SOCIAL CLUBS. FOR AIRMEN AND SERGEANTS WHO LIVE AWAY FROM HOME THERE ARE QUARTERS PROVIDED ON SITE BUT OFFICERS LIVE SEPARATELY. FAMILIES HAVE THEIR OWN HOUSES WHICH THEY RENT FROM THE R.A.F. AGAIN THE OFFICERS LIVE ON A SEPARATE SITE TO OTHER RANKS. CHILDREN OF SERVICEMEN ALL ATTEND LOCAL SCHOOLS (INFANT, JUNIOR AND SECONDARY) IN INNSWORTH OR CHURCHDOWN. MANY ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE AT THE BASE. THERE ARE BROWNIES, GIRL-GUIDES, ARMY CADETS, SUNDAY SCHOOL, A WIVES CLUB, ALL TYPES OF SPORTS (FOOTBALL, RUGBY, CRICKET, HOCKEY, TENNIS, BASKETBALL, BADMINTON, VOLLEYBALL AND SMALL BORE SHOOTING). THERE IS NO SWIMMING POOL HERE UNLIKE MANY BASES ABROAD.
